page.title: 13Working Men's Libraries
page.content: There is still the remnant of a large library in Crosskeys Miners' Institute. The majority of the books were transferred to University College Swansea in the early 1970's where they joined the libraries of many other valley "stutes". Crosskeys "stute", built in 1910, has a reading room, a games room and a billiards room. In its heyday though, local miners used the library avidly often reading heavy economics texts as well as literary classics. The "stute" was also used for evening classes in Economics and Sociology. Today, the literary function of the "stute" has largely been replaced by the screening of video films, suggesting perhaps that the institutes no longer function as an educational, as well as an entertainment and social, centre for the community.
